intro: Cynoglossum tschotkalense, commonly known as the Tschotkale leafflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, tongue-shaped leaves and showy blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation efforts.
